ygData.subject: Re: Had fun with my new song last night
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I used it to practice my brass skill in Butcherblock.  I had about a dozen critters, including Corflunk, bouncing back and forth.  Newbies in the area were
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 22 Jul 1999, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
>
> Last night I made 26th level and got to play with the Appalling Screech.
> Man what a fun song! My party was in Solesek's Eye and was about to leave,
> no one else was in the zone so I decided to see how big a train I could
> start with this song. By the time I left I had over a dozen gobs bouncing
> off me, fleeing in terror! Then on my way out I came across 3 DE guards at
> the zone to EC, so I feared them to, then shouted to the zone that their
> (the Dark Elves) guards were fleeing in terror from a lone bard, haha. I
> love being a Bard :)

I used it to practice my brass skill in Butcherblock. I had
about a dozen critters, including Corflunk, bouncing back and
forth. Newbies in the area were running to me to when they
started to lose a fight - they'd get a chance to heal up, and
unlike the guards, I wouldn't steal their kills.

The best though was when I used it on Dorn. He resisted it
like 5 times (and he's green go figure), but it finally took
and I was rewarded with the message:

"Dorn flees in terror!"

Seeing that was worth every minute of the time it took to get
to 26. :-)

27 is even MORE fun. You get to make the dark elf guards
fight each other. :-)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
